meanings.sent2: She always seems to disapprove of my choices.
meanings.sent3: Even the cat seemed to disapprove of the messy room.
meanings.sent4: The dark clouds seemed to disapprove of our picnic plans.
meanings.sent5: The teacher's stern look clearly showed her disapproval.

meanings.sent1: The committee decided to disapprove the proposal.
meanings.sent2: He disapproved the use of harmful chemicals in the experiment.
meanings.sent3: The grumpy old man would disapprove any loud noises.
meanings.sent4: The judge's silence seemed to disapprove the defendant's plea.
meanings.sent5: The principal's raised eyebrow was a clear sign of disapproval.

meanings.sent1: The board chose to disapprove the budget plan.
meanings.sent2: She disapproved the request for an extension.
meanings.sent3: The dog would disapprove any attempts to touch his toys.
meanings.sent4: The locked gate seemed to disapprove any unauthorized entry.
meanings.sent5: The strict rules clearly disapprove any form of cheating.
